modelIdentification.name: NETN AIS
modelIdentification.description:
NATO Education and Training Network (NETN) Automatic Identification System (AIS) Module.
The Automatic Identification System (AIS) is a world-wide automated tracking system used on vessels and by Vessel Traffic Services (VTS) for identifying and locating vessels by electronically exchanging messages with other nearby vessels and VTS stations. 27 message types are defined in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8 (see https://www.itu.int). Most commonly used message types are the Position Report Class A (Message types 1,2, and 3) and the Static and Voyage Related Data (Message type 5). And a commonly used live protocol to exhange AIS messages is NMEA-0183. This is an electrical and data specification for communication between marine electronics (see https://www.nmea.org).
The AIS FOM module defines all of the messages types specified in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8, with the exception of rarely used message types or message types that are more related to traffic analysis in an AIS network (i.e. 15, 16, 20, 22, 23, 25 and 26). The FOM class structure is closely aligned with the message type specification in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8, enabling easy translation to/from NMEA 0183. The message types are modelled as interaction classes and most of the class parameters are optional. The root class - AisMessage - is integrated in the RPR-FOM by subclassing RadioSignal, using the concept of HostRadioIndex to refer to the RadioTransmitter object instance on board of the vessel. The AIS message types include SOTDMA and ITDMA communication state data, but the parameters related to communication state can be omitted if there is no need to model communication.
The NETN-AIS FOM module content is based on ITU-R M.1371-5, Technical characteristics for an automatic identification system using time division multiple access in the VHF maritime mobile frequency band (https://www.itu.int).
modelIdentification.useLimitation: The NETN-AIS FOM module is simulation oriented and does not focus on the physical message format as defined by ITU-R M.1371-5. However, the FOM is aligned well with ITU-R M.1371-5, enabling relatively easy mapping to/from the message format defined in ITU-R M.1371-5.

interactionClass.name: AisRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: This is the root interaction class for all AIS messages. The interaction class contains a reference to the embedded system that represents the AIS transmitter. The embedded system should be modelled as a RadioTransmitter, an RPR-FOM object class that is subclassed from Embedded System.

parameter.name: HostRadioIndex
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Object instance ID of the embedded system host.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage
interactionClass.semantics: Super class for all AIS message types.

parameter.name: messageId
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Message type identifier.

parameter.name: repeatIndicator
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL. Message repeat Indicator. If the parameter is omitted then a zero value is assumed.

parameter.name: mmsi
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. The message is from the vessel identified by this MMSI.

interactionClass.name: AisNavigationData
interactionClass.semantics: Message Types 1, 2 and 3 share a common reporting structure for navigational data, captured in this class.

parameter.name: navigationalStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not defined). Navigational status.

parameter.name: rateOfTurn
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Rate of turn.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Speed over ground.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Course over ground.

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). True heading.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of the report. The value is only valid if the positionSystemStatus is set to NormalMode.

parameter.name: positionSystemStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: NormalMode). Status of the electronic position system (EPFS).

parameter.name: specialManeuverIndicator
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Maneuver indication.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage1
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 1: Position Report Class A.
Message type for a scheduled position report; Class A shipborne mobile equipment. This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). SOTDMA state.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage2
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 2: Position Report Class A.
Message type for an assigned scheduled position report; Class A shipborne mobile equipment. This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). SOTDMA state.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage3
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 3: Position Report Class A.
Message type for a special position report, response to interrogation; Class A shipborne mobile equipment. This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). ITTDMA state.

interactionClass.name: AisBaseStationReportAndUTCDateResponseData
interactionClass.semantics: Common reporting structure for Message Types 4 and 11 for reporting UTC time and date and, at the same time, position. It is also is used by AIS stations for determining if it is within 120 NM for response to Messages Types 20 and 23.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of report.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: posType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: undefined). Type of electronic position fixing device.

parameter.name: transmissionControl
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: stop transmission). Transmission control for long-range broadcast message.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage4
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 4: Base Station Report.
This message is to be used by fixed-location base stations to periodically report a position and time reference.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). SOTDMA state.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage11
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 11: UTC/Date Response.
Identical to Message Type 4, with the semantics of a response to inquiry. This message type is only transmitted from a mobile station as a result of a UTC request message (Message Type 10).

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). SOTDMA state.

interactionClass.name: AisStaticAndVoyageData
interactionClass.semantics: Common Static and Voyage Data for Message Types 5, 19 and 24.

parameter.name: callsign
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. 7 six-bit characters for the callsign.

parameter.name: name
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. 20 six-bit characters for the name.

parameter.name: shipType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Ship type.

parameter.name: dimBow
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). GPS Ant. distance from bow.

parameter.name: dimStern
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). GPS Ant. distance from stern.

parameter.name: dimPort
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). GPS Ant. distance from port.

parameter.name: dimStarboard
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). GPS Ant. distance from starboard.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage5
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 5: Static and Voyage Related Data.
This message type is transmitted every 6 minutes and should only be used by Class A shipborne and SAR aircraft AIS stations when reporting static or voyage related data.

parameter.name: version
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: ITU1371). AIS version.

parameter.name: imo
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero). 30 bit value for IMO ship ID number. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

parameter.name: positionFixType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: undefined). Type of electronic position fixing device.

parameter.name: etaTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

parameter.name: draught
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Maximum present static draught.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available, @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@). 20 six-bit characters for the destination. For SAR aircraft, the use of this field may be decided by the responsible administration.

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not ready). Data terminal equipment (DTE).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage19
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 19: Extended Class B CS Position Report.
A slightly more detailed report than Message Type 18 for vessels using Class B transmitters. Omits navigational status and rate of turn. Fields are as in the common navigation block and the Message Type 5 message.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Speed over ground.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Course over ground.

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). True heading.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of the report. The value is only valid if the positionSystemStatus is set to NormalMode.

parameter.name: positionSystemStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: NormalMode). Status of the electronic position system (EPFS).

parameter.name: posType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: undefined). Type of electronic position fixing device.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not ready). Data terminal equipment (DTE).

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: autonomous and continuous mode). Mode.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage24
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 24: Static Data Report.
Equivalent of Message Type 5 for ships using Class B equipment. Also used to associate an MMSI with a name on either class A or class B equipment. This message type may be in part A or part B format. According to the standard, parts A and B are expected to be broadcast in adjacent pairs.

parameter.name: partNumber
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Part number.

parameter.name: vendorId
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. (Part B) 3 six-bit chars.

parameter.name: unitModelCode
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. (Part B) Unit Model Code.

parameter.name: serialNumber
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Serial Number.

interactionClass.name: AisBinaryMessageData
interactionClass.semantics: Binary Payload for Message Types 6 and 8. The interpretation of the binary payload is controlled by: - The Designated Area Code (DAC), which is a jurisdiction code: 366 for the United States. It uses the same encoding as the area designator in MMMSIs; see [ITU-MID]. 1 designates international (ITU) messages. - The FID, which is the Functional ID for a message subtype. In some sources this is abbreviated FI.

parameter.name: dac
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Designated area code (DAC).

parameter.name: fi
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Functional ID (FID).

parameter.name: data
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Binary data up to 920 bits.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage6
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 6: Binary Addressed Message.
This message type is an addressed point-to-point message with unspecified binary payload.

parameter.name: seqNumber
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Sequence Number.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Destination MMSI.

parameter.name: retransmit
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false, no retransmit). Retransmit flag.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage8
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 8: Binary Broadcast Message.
This message type is a broadcast message with a binary payload.

interactionClass.name: AcknowledgeData
interactionClass.semantics: Acknowledge data for Message Types 7 and 13.

parameter.name: dest1
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. MMSI number 1.

parameter.name: dest2
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). MMSI number 2.

parameter.name: dest3
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). MMSI number 3.

parameter.name: dest4
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). MMSI number 4.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage7
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 7: Binary Acknowledge.
This message type is a receipt acknowledgement to the senders of a previous messages of Message Type 6. Total length varies depending on the number of destination MMSIs included (1..4).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage13
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 13: Safety-Related Acknowledgement.
This message type is a receipt acknowledgement to senders of previous messages of Message Type 12.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage9
interactionClass.semantics:
Message type 9: Standard SAR Aircraft Position Report.
Tracking information for search-and-rescue aircraft.

parameter.name: altitude
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Altitude.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Speed over ground.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Course over ground.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of the report. The value is only valid if the positionSystemStatus is set to NormalMode.

parameter.name: positionSystemStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: NormalMode). Status of the electronic position system (EPFS).

parameter.name: regionalReserved
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero value). Reserved.

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not ready). Data terminal equipment (DTE). If the parameter is omitted then no information is available.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: autonomous and continuous mode). Mode flag.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

parameter.name: commsState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). Communication state. If the parameter is omitted then no information is available.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage10
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 10: UTC/Date Inquiry.
Request for UTC/Date information from an AIS base station.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Destination MMSI.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage12
interactionClass.semantics:
Type 12: Addressed Safety-Related Message.
This is a point-to-point text message. The payload is interpreted as six-bit text.

parameter.name: seqNum
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Sequence Number.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. Destination MMSI.

parameter.name: retransmitFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false, no retransmit). Retransmit flag. If the parameter is omitted then no information is available.

parameter.name: message
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. 1-156 chars of six-bit text.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage14
interactionClass.semantics:
Type 14: Safety-Related Broadcast Message.
This is a broadcast text message. The payload is interpreted as six-bit text.

parameter.name: message
parameter.semantics: REQUIRED. 1-161 chars of six-bit text.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage17
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 17: DGNSS Broadcast Binary Message.
This message type is used to broadcast differential corrections for GPS. The data in the payload is intended to be passed directly to GPS receivers capable of accepting such corrections.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Position data.

parameter.name: data
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero value). Differential correction data.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage18
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 18: Standard Class B CS Position Report.
A less detailed report than message types 1-3 for vessels using Class B transmitters. Omits navigational status and rate of turn.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Speed over ground.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Course over ground.

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). True heading.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of the report. The value is only valid if the positionSystemStatus is set to NormalMode.

parameter.name: positionSystemStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: NormalMode). Status of the electronic position system (EPFS).

parameter.name: classBUnitFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). False if Class B SOTDMA unit. True if Class B CS (Carrier Sense) unit.

parameter.name: classBDisplayFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). False if no visual display. True if has display.

parameter.name: classBDscFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). True if unit is attached to a VHF voice radio with DSC capability. False otherwise.

parameter.name: classBBandFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). Base stations can command units to switch frequency. If this flag is true, then the unit can use any part of the marine channel. False otherwise.

parameter.name: classBMsg22Flag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). True if unit can accept a channel assignment via Message Type 22. False otherwise.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: autonomous and continuous mode). Mode.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

parameter.name: commsState
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero filled record). Communication state.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage21
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 21: Aid-to-Navigation Report.
Identification and location message to be emitted by aids to navigation such as buoys and lighthouses.

parameter.name: aidType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not specified). Type of aid.

parameter.name: name
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: 34 six-bit @ charachters). Up to max 34 six-bit charachters for the name of the aid.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: dimBow
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Distance from bow.

parameter.name: dimStern
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Distance from stern.

parameter.name: dimPort
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Distance from port.

parameter.name: dimStarboard
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Distance from starboard.

parameter.name: positionType
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: undefined). Type of electronic position fixing device.

parameter.name: utcTime
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Time of the report. The value is only valid if the positionSystemStatus is set to NormalMode.

parameter.name: positionSystemStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: NormalMode). Status of the electronic position system (EPFS).

parameter.name: offPositionFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). Off-Position Indicator. The Off-Position Indicator is for floating Aids-to-Navigation only: false means on position; true means off position. Only valid if UTCsecond is available.

parameter.name: regional
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: zero value). Reserved.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

parameter.name: virtualFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: false). Virtual-aid flag. The Virtual Aid flag is interpreted as follows: false = real Aid to Navigation at indicated position; true = virtual Aid to Navigation simulated by nearby AIS station.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Defaut: autonomous and continuous mode). Mode.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage27
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 27: Long Range AIS Broadcast message.
This message type is primarily intended for long-range detection of AIS Class A equipped vessels (typically by satellite). This message has a similar content to Messages 1, 2 and 3, but the total number of bits has been compressed to allow for increased propagation delays associated with long-range detection.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: unaugmented GNSS). Position accuracy.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not in use). RAIM flag.

parameter.name: navigationStatus
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not defined). Navigational status.

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). AIS (Lat,Lon) position.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Speed over ground.

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: not available). Course over ground.

parameter.name: gnssPositionStatusFlag
parameter.semantics: OPTIONAL (Default: true). GNSS Position status. False if current GNSS position. True if not GNSS position.

simpleData.name: MMSI
simpleData.semantics: The MMSI number (Maritime Mobile Service Identity) is a unique nine-digit number for identifying a vessel. An MMSI number has the format MIDXXXXXX. The first three digits are called MID (Maritime Identification Digits) and represent the nationality. The last six digits are used for the unique identification of the vessel.

simpleData.name: RateOfTurn
SpeedOverGround
simpleData.semantics: Speed over ground in meters/second.

simpleData.name: CourseOverGround
simpleData.semantics: Course over ground in degrees relative to the true north.

simpleData.name: TrueHeading
simpleData.semantics: The true heading is [0, 360) degrees.

simpleData.name: SlotTimeOut
simpleData.semantics: SlotTimeOut specifies the number of frames remaining until a new slot is selected: 0 means that this was the last transmission in this slot. 1-7 means that 1 to 7 frames respectively are left until slot change.

simpleData.name: ShipType
simpleData.semantics: Type of ship and cargo type. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

simpleData.name: BowDimension
simpleData.semantics: Distance from bow. Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship.

simpleData.name: SternDimension
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from stern. Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship.

simpleData.name: PortDimension
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from port Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship.

simpleData.name: StarboardDimension
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from starboard. Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship.

simpleData.name: IMO
simpleData.semantics: IMO ship ID number. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

simpleData.name: Draught
simpleData.semantics: The maximum present static draught in meters. Not applicable to SAR aircraft, should be set to 0.

simpleData.name: PartNumber
simpleData.semantics: Part number: Bit 0 - Part A. Bit 1 - Part B.

simpleData.name: UnitModelCode
simpleData.semantics: (Part B) Unit Model Code.

simpleData.name: SerialNumber
simpleData.semantics: (Part B) Serial Number.

simpleData.name: SequenceNumber
simpleData.semantics: Sequence Number.

simpleData.name: DesignatedAreaCode
simpleData.semantics: Designated area code (DAC).

simpleData.name: FunctionID
simpleData.semantics: Functional ID (FID).

simpleData.name: Altitude
simpleData.semantics: Altitude of SAR aircraft.

simpleData.name: RegionalReserved
simpleData.semantics: Regional reserved value.

simpleData.name: Latitude
simpleData.semantics: Latitude in degrees. Values up to plus or minus 90 degrees, North = positive, South = negative.

simpleData.name: Longitude
simpleData.semantics: Longitude in degrees (-180,+180). Values up to plus or minus 180 degrees, East = positive, West = negative. A value of 181 degrees indicates that longitude is not available and is the default.

simpleData.name: RepeatIndicator
simpleData.semantics: Message repeat Indicator. The Repeat Indicator is a directive to an AIS transceiver that this message should be rebroadcast. This was intended as a way of getting AIS messages around hills and other obstructions in coastal waters, but is little used as base station coverage is more effective. It is intended that the bit be incremented on each retransmission, to a maximum of three hops. A value of 3 indicates "Do not repeat".

simpleData.name: Bit03
simpleData.semantics: 3 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit05
simpleData.semantics: 5 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit13
simpleData.semantics: 13 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit10
simpleData.semantics: 10 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit06
simpleData.semantics: 6 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: UTCTime
simpleData.semantics: Number of seconds since 1 Jan 1970 (wallclock time) or since the start of the simulation (logical time).

simpleData.name: NumberOfSlots
simpleData.semantics: ITDMA Number of Slots.

simpleData.name: SlotIncrement
simpleData.semantics: ITDMA Slot Increment.

simpleData.name: SubMessage
simpleData.semantics: The sub message depends on the current value in slot time-out as described in Table 19 of [ITU-R M.1371-5].

simpleData.name: IntegerType
simpleData.semantics: 16 bit integer value.

enumeratedData.name: MsgIdEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the message type.

enumeratedData.name: NavigationStatusEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate the navigational status.

enumeratedData.name: ManeuverIndicatorEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate a maneuver.

enumeratedData.name: RAIMEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the receiver autonomous integrity monitoring (RAIM) flag of the electronic position fixing device; 0 = RAIM not in use = default; 1 = RAIM in use.

enumeratedData.name: PositionAccuracyEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate the position accuracy. The position accuracy indicates the accuracy of the fix. A value of 1 indicates a DGPS-quality fix with an accuracy of < 10ms. 0, the default, indicates an unaugmented GNSS fix with accuracy > 10m.

enumeratedData.name: CommunicationSyncStateEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value that defines the sync state of the own station.

enumeratedData.name: PositionFixTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for he EPFD type.

enumeratedData.name: AssignedModeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the assigned mode: 0 = Station operating in autonomous and continuous mode 1 = Station operating in assigned mode

enumeratedData.name: TransmissionControlEnum
enumeratedData.semantics:
Enumeration value for the transmission control for long-range broadcast message.
0 = default – Class-A AIS station stops transmission of Message 27 within an AIS base station coverage area. 1 = Request Class-A station to transmit Message 27 within an AIS base station coverage area. Base station coverage area should be defined by Message 23; If Message 23 is not received, the AIS station which is allowed to transmit on CH75 and 76 should ignore this bit and transmit Message 27.

enumeratedData.name: CommunicationStateSelectorEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the communication state.

enumeratedData.name: AidTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the aid type. According to [IALA], the aid type field has values 1-15 for fixed and 16-31 for floating aids to navigation.

enumeratedData.name: PositionSystemStatusEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: OPTIONS (Default: NormalMode). Indicates the status of the Positioning System. Only if in NormalMode the utcSecond parameter value is valid.

fixedRecordData.name: SOTDMACommunicationState

field.name: slotTimeOut
field.semantics: The number of frames remaining until a new slot is selected.

fixedRecordData.name: ITDMACommunicationState
DifferentialCorrectionData
fixedRecordData.semantics: Differential correction data. If interrogated and differential correction service not available, the data field should remain empty (zero bits). This should be interpreted by the recipient as DGNSS data words set to zero.

field.name: n
field.semantics: Number of DGNSS data words following the two word header, up to a maximum of 29.

field.name: health
field.semantics: Reference station health (specified in Recommendation ITU-R M.823).

field.name: dataWords
field.semantics: DGNSS message data words excluding parity.
